author: Nathan Blair

text: @zak832 You're misinformed. They didn't throw Kirby in this game to make some extra cash. Good-Feel told Nintendo that they didn't like how their game turned out, and thought that it was missing something. Nintendo offered Good-Feel Kirby, they accepted, and think that it fixed the problems they had with the game.

text:
It's a nice track, very relaxing like some people said, but very different from typical Kirby music. I think I prefer the moer "upbeat" style, but this one is good nonetheless.
I won't buy this game, anyway, I have a huge backlog and I've never been a big fan of Kirby anyway. I hope I can try it once, though, it seems very original.
